captions.text:
Here's something most people don't know about
marijuana. Officially the U.S. federal government

classifies it as a Schedule 1 drug. That is
the strictest classification they have, period.

Full stop. That means the government thinks
marijuana is more dangerous than Schedule

2 drugs like cocaine or meth. It means they
think marijuana is on the same plane as heroin.

About 3,000 people died from heroin overdoses
in 2010. You know how many people died directly

of overdosing on marijuana? Zero. And I don't
mean zero in 2010, I mean zero in basically

recorded human history. Which isn't to say
that smoking hay bales worth of pot is a good

idea. It's not. But notice what I did there.
You hear that all the time. That's what we

in the media business call the "to be sure"
paragraph. It's the paragraph where we cover

our asses. Almost everyone says that. Even the 
people who think legalizing marijuana is a

great idea don't say it's a good thing. The
argument for legalizing pot isn't that pot

is good, but that the war on pot is bad. But
there is a way in which legal pot could be

a huge public health win. I mean one of the
biggest public health wins we've had in decades,

saving huge numbers of lives. Let's go back
to that drug schedule. There is one drug you

won't see on there, even though it is a hell
of a lot more dangerous than pot or even cocaine.

That's alcohol. The thing about alcohol is
it's really bad for you, lethally bad for

you. I don't want to be a hypocrite here.
I enjoy a drink. But the evidence on this,

you cannot run away from it. The Centers for
Disease Control and Prevention say there are

88,000 deaths each year attributable to alcohol.
About 25,000 of them are just direct overdoses.

The numbers here are really amazing. A Columbia
University study found that being drunk increases

the risk of a fatal accident 13-fold. Pot,
by contrast, increases the risk by less than

2-fold. Then there's all the other nasty stuff
alcohol leads to. It's a big contributor to

violence, to crime, to addiction. It breaks
up families. It gives people cancer. It gives

them liver failure. People forget this but
prohibition -- we laugh at it now but it was

happening for a reason. People drank more
then and it was a scourge. So this is the

question with legal pot: Would people use
it as a replacement or a complement to alcohol.

If it's a replacement, it's a huge deal. Marijuana
is a lot safer to use than alcohol. People

don't die from it. They rarely kill others
while on it. More marijuana and less alcohol

means fewer deaths from intoxication, fewer
drunk driving fatalities, less crime, less

violence. But if marijuana complements alcohol
rather than replacing it, then it's a problem.

If it makes people for whatever reason, drink
more, then legalizing pot might actually make

our alcohol problem worse. Now I'm going to
say something that kind of sucks: we actually don't

know the answer here. There is encouraging
early evidence. In a survey of Canadian medical

marijuana users, 41% said they replace alcohol
with marijuana. Another survey of California

medical marijuana users found they drank less
than the national average. But those are medical

marijuana users. They might be different from
the general population. People using marijuana

for fun might have a very different relationship
to alcohol than people using marijuana because

they're sick. But this isn't just something
we can study, it's something that we can affect,

that we can change. Since we know that a lot
of people want to use some kind of mind-altering substance,

we could arrange public policy to push them
towards the safer one. But right now, we can't

because the federal government, against all
the evidence, thinks that marijuana is an

incredibly, insanely dangerous substance with
absolutely no redeeming value under any circumstance.
What are they smoking?

title: Weed is not more dangerous than alcohol

Side note...My dad was a hard working, but raging alcoholic. I suffered a 
LOT from him through the year's, and I knew then that his addiction was a 
huge influence on his behavior. I started smoking weed at he tender age of 
14, when one of my friends Mom decided to share. I have been hooked for 30 
year's now. Happily hooked at that. My own Husband KNOWS when I get into 
mega bitch mode or whatever, he'll actually tell me to go smoke. Cause when 
I do then my brain calms down, my attitude and demeanor calm down. Then we 
can have a rational conversation. The longest I have gone w/out smoking was 
3 year's. It is my sanctuary, stress reliever, and all around life 
saver...Usually someone else's due to my temper LOL. But seriously I rarely 
drink any kind of alcohol, and I will forever be a HUGE supporter of weed 
as a recreational, weekend, daily Happy place. WHY would you not want to 
world and the people in in happier? Like Katt Willams said: Weed just makes 
you hungry,happy, and sleepy. That's it! So true, and the BEST part of weed 
vs alcohol...Weed WON'T leave you with a headache, nor will it keep you 
from getting a decent night's sleep. Alcohol will screw all that up for 
you. And for those of you that are whining about it, but have never had the 
guts to try it...SHUT UP! TRY it first, THEN decide instead of just being 
another empty headed follower of the masses. Blessed Be!﻿

Here is my weed story, and I must share for the masses to laugh at...And 
understand! I was at a friends house when one of his buddies came by to 
chill. This fool pulled out THE largest blunt I had EVER seen in my damn 
life! It was BIGGER than a Cuban cigar! I took maybe 3-4 hit's. And like 
most hard core or daily smokers know, sometimes it'll take a minute to kick 
in. So I decided to venture out onto the back porch and sat on a concrete 
bench. They were in and out grilling, talking etc. My friends man came out 
to tell me dinner was ready to come in. I simply looked him dead in the 
eyes and said this...Verbatim: Ok, that's great. I'll make you a deal. Tie 
a rope from that tree behind you to the kitchen sink. Then I can actually 
get there from here. Otherwise I'll have to CRAWL in! It didn't hit me, it 
bitch slapped me harder than a pimp! These just as stoned as me friends of 
mine helped me inside, and promptly had me lay down on a fucking FULL 
motion water bed! NOOOO! Never ever do that when super stoned. NEVER! Every 
move makes you feel like you're on Titanic and you're gonna die. And fuck 
even trying to get out of that evil ass bed till you sobered up! Case in 
point, when smoking w/friends set some boundaries, and have them place you 
in a safe place like a sofa or recliner. Is that too much to ask? Smoke 
safely my friends! Blessed Be!﻿

comments.text:
I'm really tired of people saying weed is less bad than alcohol. Both are 
absolutely fine when consumed with moderation but both can be horrible with 
irresponsible people and addicts. Society decided to draw the line of legal 
drugs at alcohol for good reasons. Lets just look at the addicts of both 
drugs. An alcoholic will be violent and his addictions will have a negative 
effect on his life but they can still be productive and generally function 
in society. It's a major health risk but it won't fry your brain. Weed 
addicts on the other side usually can't function very well. Weed is more 
addictive and just has dangerous for your health. I know many people who 
developed mental issues related to weed (schizophrenia) and heavy addiction 
leading to other harder drugs. So, is weed better than alcohol: IMO no!. Is 
the war on drugs worst than legalising weed: IMO probably.

TLDR: I'm for legalization (with strict regulations) not because weed is a 
magical fairytale drug but because war on drug isn't really working.﻿

consumption. Alcohol has a much larger cognitive impairment, despite what

4. correlation does not equal causation. A staggering amount of those with

increase in schizophrenia. schizophrenia rates are also relatively the same

people smoking marijuana is pretty high. 
5.In conclusion, alcohol is much worse, causes more death, and has a more 
significant mental effect.

If marijuana is legalized, eventually it will find itself mainstream and 
more widely used. I don't know if marijuana effects everyone this way, but 
it has caused me to become more connected with myself. My psychology and 
spirituality. It has caused me to become more in tune with a "natural order 
of things". This alignment of my thinking has led to my noticing how this 
artificial system we[humans] have set up has overrun its course. It would 
seem to have reached a climax, or a crucial threshold in its own existence. 
There is a hierarchy amongst living systems. Each level would appear to 
perceive itself as the highest level. As humans, we see the hierarchies 
beneath us, such as cellular or fungic systems of existence, or even the 
atomic and subatomic systems. We can also perceive solar and galactic 
systems, but for some reason, we do not perceive the organism of mankind. 
All of us people are it's constituents, its "cells", if you will. It too 
appears to be conscious. Various ideas touch this concept, such as in the 
social sciences, but still some connecting element is missing from those 
sciences. This organism that we make up also has various stages of growth 
and development. What mankind[macro] is lacking is the consolidation of 
itself. Like a teenager, unsure of its purpose and place in the world. This 
"state of mind" if you will manifests itself down onto our level as 
competition. Man[micro] fights and kills himself because He is unable to 
recognize that all that He sees externally is only a reflection of His 
internal. As above, so below. Can I say this type of thought I experience 
was caused by marijuana? Not exclusively no, but the mindframe that 
marijuana induces gives one access to the Source.﻿

for the most part. To say that drinking causes relationship problems and 
violence, it's all in the individual. I and many others become more gentle 
drunk, we care more about our partners, and if anything the relationship 
gets better. To cause violence, I mean I could barely even pick up 50 lbs 
while drunk without falling over, let alone cause a crime. You obviously 
are a bigger fan of smoking than drinking, and it sounds like you're 
willing to throw one under the bus meaning you aren't creating a good 
platform of comparison. All I'm getting is, "Drinking is horrible for you. 
So lets smoke weed instead, that's why it's good." Fact: People will think 
you're smart if you bring in statistics and numbers. Sorry, this video is 
just complete shit when it's suppose to be about supporting pot, but you 
spend most of the video telling us about alcohol being bad. You are not a 
hypocrite as stated in the video, you are a douchebag by supporting 
yourself using a phrase like "I enjoy A drink." which has no credit to it, 
but merely a vague *(asterisks) to the conversation. Kind of like if I were 
to say, "I enjoy a bit of pot. But, *___*(Negative comments). Didn't mean 
to be such a hypocrite with all that bit of pot I have once smoked!" 
Perhaps rename the video to, "Alcohol is bad." then make a new video 
called, "Why weed is not dangerous." and actually cover more facts about 
why it's not dangerous besides the whole "ZERO people have died." shit that 
we have all heard a million times. The rest of the facts about weed stated 
was "We don't know yet! We'll only know if we try it. Insert unoriginal 
conclusion." ﻿
